results.title: Sales Recruiter
results.description:
Potential to earn $40,000-$120,000 in your first year with average recruiters making $120,000-$200,000 in the second year ($19.23/hour + Commission)!


As part of the Host Healthcare Recruitment team, the Senior Recruiter drives successful placements of clinicians on assignment across multiple healthcare specialties and clients. Senior Recruiters develop strong relationships with clinicians nationwide through proactive outreach efforts to recruit and place them in open temporary job opportunities aligned with their clinical and specialty experience across health systems, acute care hospitals, outpatient clinics, home health organizations and more.

The successful Senior Recruiter is self-motivated, with a strong desire to meet or exceed placement goals and passion for helping clinicians to thrive in their careers. The recruiter is a creative, energetic individual with excellent interpersonal communication skills and professional demeanor and maturity. The Senior Recruiter maintains a positive outlook and serves as a positive influence within the team. He or she is also well-organized, comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, and exhibits Host’s core values of Team Strength, Personal Accountability, Leading with Integrity, Driven by Excellence, Embracing Positivity and Mastering Our Craft.


Essential Duties & Responsibilities:

• Consistently meets and/or exceeds sales goals by driving new placements and retention of clinicians on assignment.

• Actively prospects, pre-screens and activates candidate leads through cold calling, email and text blasting. Identifies relevant open job opportunities that match the candidate’s specialty experience and professional interests.

• Understands clinician job requirements. Creates compelling candidate profiles for submission to hiring managers. Follows up daily on active candidate submissions and collaborates with account managers to ensure candidates move rapidly through the hiring process.

• Ensures interviews are scheduled and works with account managers to solicit assignment and extension offers on behalf of candidates. Able to pre-close and close offers with candidates to drive offer acceptance.

• Maintains strong rapport with clinicians on assignment to ensure a positive experience and actively drives assignment extensions and rebooking of clinicians at other facilities. Assists in resolving service or credentialing issues that may arise.

• Accurately enters all candidate and placement activity into the Host Healthcare database.


Qualifications:

• High school diploma required. Bachelor’s degree preferred.

• Previous sales experience and/or healthcare knowledge preferred.

• Excellent verbal and written communications. Able to negotiate and problem-solve collaboratively with candidates and internal team members.

• Excellent time management and prioritization skills. Able to maintain an organized, well-run sales desk and meet required turnaround times. Comfortable within in a fast-paced work environment.

• High comfort level operating within technology platforms (e.g., Target Recruit)


Benefits and Compensation:

• Uncapped commission!

• Benefits on day 1 (medical, dental, vision) and company-paid life insurance; short and long-term disability; supplemental life insurance for yourself, spouse & child(ren); and multiple voluntary benefits [Hawaii residents receive benefits on the first day of the month following hire date!]

• Eligible for 401K after 6 months of hire - company match at 1 year!

• Remote work option - work from anywhere in the United States

• We provide your equipment (laptop, monitors, headset, etc.)

• Discounted gym memberships

• Flexible PTO

• 10 paid holidays

• Training programs for growth and development

• Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

• Pet insurance - don't forget about our furry friends!

results.title: Human Resources Consultant
results.description:
Company Description

Are you ready to join the Greater team?

Greater Human Capital (Greater) is a team of passionate and skilled consultants, dedicated to delivering outstanding experiences for people and organizations.

We are seeking candidates to join our team as a Human Resources (HR) Consultant. The HR Consultant is responsible for partnering with our clients to design and deliver HR policies, procedures and programs, as well as managing associated projects and change management. The ideal candidate is passionate about solving complex challenges in a dynamic environment and brings an entrepreneurial spirit to their work with clients and beyond.

This position is part-time, with the opportunity to expand to full-time, and fully remote (based in the United States), and will not require any office duties or travel during the COVID-19 pandemic.



Job Description

What you’ll do as an HR Consultant:

  • Serve our clients as a thought partner and advisor, guiding strategic planning and service delivery efforts around HR and people and culture-related priorities, strategies and initiatives.
  • Spearhead the design and implementation of full-cycle, cross-cutting HR solutions in areas such as: recruiting and onboarding, benefits and compensation administration and design, performance management, employee engagement, training and development, and employee communications.
  • Act as an external HR project manager by creating project plans, mobilizing client resources, managing timelines, and proactively identifying issues or obstacles to mitigate risk and enable efficiency.
  • Provide leadership and guidance on HR matters related to federal, state, and local compliance.
  • Support other HR or people and culture-related projects, services, needs as requested by our clients.
  • Contribute to Greater’s firm and brand development through communications, culture building, process improvements and other thought leadership efforts.



Qualifications

What you bring to the table:

We are committed to an inclusive hiring process. If you feel you would be a strong fit for the role, we encourage you to apply even if you do not meet all the criteria listed below. 

The nitty gritty:

  • 2-4 years of relevant experience (HR consulting, HR generalist, or HR business partner preferred)
  • Minimum of 1 year of external consulting experience or other client-facing experience
  • Bachelor’s degree required; advanced degree in related specialization area preferred
  • Demonstrated interest in HR profession through certifications (PHR/SPHR/SHRM-CP/SHRM-SCP), coursework, professional organizations, conference attendance, etc.
  • Proficiency with HRIS and ATS systems; Workday and ADP proficiency preferred
  • Proficiency with business productivity software (GSuite, Microsoft Office, Slack) and comfort with human resources systems and platform technologies
  • Strong communication skills (oral and written), including the ability to create presentations/decks for external consumption and present complex information eloquently for variety of external stakeholders

The big picture:

  • Desire to be part of a high-performing and flexible team
  • Comfortable working independently in a fast-paced and flexible startup environment
  • Strong client and service delivery orientation; ability to manage multiple projects and client engagements at the same time
  • Comfortable with ambiguity and rolling up sleeves to solve problems creatively
  • Ability to maintain personal effectiveness from home and remain positively motivated under pressure
  • Strong research capabilities and project management skills
  • Successful record of building and maintaining trusted relationships with clients across the spectrum of seniority; ability to build relationships virtually (Zoom, Slack, over the phone, etc.)
  • Ability to gather, synthesize and analyze quantitative and qualitative data from stakeholder interviews, focus groups, employee surveys, or other sources
  • Strong commitment to driving an inclusive work environment and culture
  • Strong sense of professional ethics and accountability



Additional Information

Our Core Values

  • Great Work: We’re honest and ethical, and we believe in the power of our work to have a positive impact on organizations and individuals.
  • Great Results: We develop, design, and deliver tailored solutions that generate impactful outcomes and sustainable value.
  • Great Lives: We value self-care, family care, and community care above all else.
  • Greater Together: We’re inclusive and reflective, and we believe in the power of diverse teams. 

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

Greater is absolutely and unequivocally committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion in all aspects of our practice. We strive to build and sustain a diverse team and strongly encourage applications from candidates of color. 

Greater is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will receive consideration for employment, without regard to race, color, religion, creed, national origin, gender or gender-identity, age, marital status, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability, pregnancy or parental status, or any other basis prohibited by law and our core values.

results.title: Recruiter/HR Specialist
results.description:
About Us:

Located in Seattle, Washington in the United States, CG Tech Services (cgtechservices.com) is a Managed Service Provider (MSP), focused on providing best in class IT support and cybersecurity services for businesses and not-for-profits of 5-1,000 employees.

Job Description:
We are seeking a skilled human resources specialist who is passionate about recruiting, and supporting and developing talent through our company's policies and procedures. Our ideal candidate will be responsible and reliable, experienced in recruiting work, screening, interviewing, and assessing candidates. They should be highly efficient, organized, and approachable. We expect applicants to have a solid knowledge of various HR functions and administrative responsibilities. Under limited supervision, the HR Recruiter Specialist provides support in functional areas of Human Resources which include recruitment, onboarding, personnel records, regulatory reporting requirements, benefits administration and other areas as needed. This is a fully remote position that would be working with existing and recruiting new team members in the United States, South Africa, the Philippines, and other countries.

This would be a good fit for someone who:

• Is humble, motivated, and emotionally intelligent, specifically with a high degree of empathy.

• Enjoys helping others succeed and sees their role as maximizing the output of their team.

• Loves a faster-paced, no-drama environment where office politics, backstabbing, gossip, and negativity are not tolerated.

• Is extremely detail-oriented and appreciates people who take an organized, systematic approach to achieving success.

• Likes the idea of working for a smaller but growing company where their ideas and contributions directly impact the company’s success, direction, and growth.

• Is a quick, self-motivated learner who wants to work for a company that will invest in their education.

• Wants a position that will offer upward earning and career advancement; we want people who are interested in growth, learning, and becoming part of our team long-term.

Hours:
This is a full-time position of 40 hours a week. The expectation is that the majority of your hours worked would be Monday through Friday, 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM Pacific Time to collaborate with our team. However, hours will have some flexibility to conduct interviews with job candidates in various time zones.

Responsibilities:

• Collaborates with department managers to identify and draft detailed and accurate job descriptions and hiring criteria.

• Identifies and implements efficient and effective recruiting methods and strategies based on the available role, industry standards, and the needs of the organization.

• Manage job posting and advertisement processes.

• Attends and participates in online job fairs and recruiting events.

• Maintain organizational charts and detailed job descriptions along with salary records

• Screens applications and selects qualified candidates.

• Prepare and distribute assessments and numerical, language, and logical reasoning test.

• Schedules interviews, oversees preparation of interview questions, and other hiring and selection materials.

• Update employee records with new hire information and/or changes in employment status.

• Implement training and development plans as part of new team member onboarding.

• Performs employee onboarding to include data entry into the HR Information system and new employee orientation. Ensures data entered is complete and accurate and provides guidance to employees ensuring they have a thorough understanding of company policies and procedures.

• Assists in creating and updating the employee handbook.

• Ensures compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations, and company policies.

• Performs other duties as assigned.

Requirements

Skills & Qualifications:

• Excellent spoken and written English communication skills.

• Successful work experience as a Human Resources Specialist, officer, recruiter, administrator, or other HR position

• Strong working knowledge of HR functions and procedures (e.g., pay and benefits, recruitment, training, and development)

• Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite, using Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS), and LinkedIn Recruiter

• In-depth knowledge of or willingness to learn hiring strategies, labor laws, and employment diversity, equity, and inclusivity.

• Commitment to staying current on the understanding of labor laws and disciplinary procedures.

• Proficient with or the ability to quickly learn applicant-tracking software or other recruitment systems.

• Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills.

• Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

• Ability to create and implement sourcing strategies for recruitment for a variety of roles.

• Proactive and independent with the ability to take initiative.

• Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.

• Familiarity with laws, regulations, and best practices applicable to hiring and recruitment.

• Aptitude for critical thinking, problem-solving, and decision making.

• Strength of character, ethics, commitment, reliability, and integrity.

Education & Experience:
Minimum of three (3) years of related work experience in HR, or a higher education degree and one (1) year of related work experience in Human Resources.

Physical Requirements:
Prolonged periods of sitting/standing at a desk and working on a computer, including VoIP phone calls and video meetings.

Other Requirements:• You will need to provide your own computer that is running Windows 10/11.

• Allow us to install software on your computer that keeps it up to date with security patches and anti-virus because we work with heavily regulated industries in the United States. Security precautions are paramount for us.

• Have a headset that connects to your computer to use our VoIP phone system to communicate with our team and job candidates.

• Have Internet access of at least 20 Mbps download and 10 Mbps upload speeds to work with our systems.

Benefits

Professional Development:

This position has the opportunity to grow into an HR Manager, Director of HR, or Chief Human Resources Office.

 

Cultural Fit Considerations:
As this job posting is to an international audience with differing beliefs and cultural norms, please be aware that we are a progressive company with LGBTQIA+ team members and clients. While we respect and honor many forms of diversity, equity, and inclusivity, LGBTQIA+ people in the United States and other countries do not have equal protection nor treatment. This statement is not meant to exclude recognizing and celebrating other forms of diversity important to our team, but to be explicit in informing you of an important aspect of our team and clients.

 

Equal Employment Opportunity PolicyWe prohibit discrimination with respect to the hiring or promotion of individuals, conditions of employment, disciplinary and discharge practices, or any other aspect of employment on the basis of sex, race, color, age, national origin, religion, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, veteran status, or any other basis of discrimination prohibited by applicable local, state, or United State of America federal law.

results.title: Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist / Recruiter with Polish
results.description:
Who are we?

With its European headquarter located in Prague, Prodensa is a global company supporting clients’ international operations. We are a part of an international consulting group, that delivers a 360-degree service, starting from market intelligence, through tax & legal compliance, HR & recruitment services, business advisory, digital marketing support and interim agile teams & experts to launching ready-made companies and organizations. With over 35 years of experience, presence in 140 countries and 800+ >1MLN USD projects already delivered, we are one of the most trusted partners in this business area.

We are selective not only of the Candidates, but also of our Clients – and we do care about both.

This is also why our recruitment division is one of the top – focusing mostly on areas in demand, like IT tech & SW development, digital, data & e-commerce, medical & pharmaceutical, banking & finance, sales and customer support or R&D and manufacturing in aerospace, automotive, construction and other industries.

We are looking for an experienced recruiter with Polish for our internal projects as well as for one of our renowned clients:

A leading materials science and manufacturing expert headquartered in the USA, operating in 21 countries with a global team of 25,000 employees.

Location: Poland - remote

Possible cooperation forms: permanent employment / freelance contract full-time or part-time

Do you want to be a part of a well-resourced company that has a modern business approach and uses state-of-the-art recruitment technologies? Are you a fan of holocratic company structure where you can realise your full potential and try yourself in various roles and industries? Then this offer is the right fit for you!

Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist will be responsible for identifying and screening candidates and building partnerships with line managers to conduct talent acquisition activities. The ideal candidate must have a proven track record in creatively sourcing and hiring talents for the automotive sector.

Your role will entail:

  • Responsibility for the entire recruitment process ensuring proper candidate management and maintenance of the applicant tracking system,
  • Providing information and guidance around the recruitment process, sharing market insights, proposing recruitment strategy and providing regular feedback and following up on the process,
  • Proposing, implementing, and maintaining recruitment KPIs,
  • Performing web research and leveraging Social Media channels as relevant in accordance with sourcing strategy,
  • Responsibility for the development and execution of internal and external sourcing strategies,
  • Planning and evaluating sourcing methods used to recruit quality candidates, with an emphasis on identifying new sources,
  • Identifying and developing branding initiatives and establishing relationships with relevant institutions that could be candidate sources (schools, universities, associations, etc.),
  • Implementation of Talent Acquisition processes and acting as an ambassador of recruitment culture,
  • Cooperation with HR and hiring managers to present and establish a new recruitment model and processes
  • Ensure a high level of candidate experience.

Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in human resources management or similar area of study
  • A minimum 3-4 years of experience in full life cycle recruitment
  • Experience in recruitment processes for automotive and global business services sectors
  • Knowledge of the labor market and experience in leveraging different sourcing techniques (e.g. LinkedIn, social media, direct search)
  • Effective screening and interviewing skills
  • Innovative mindset, to identify and establish recruitment operational efficiency
  • Fluent English and Polish - a must
  • Advanced proficiency in MS Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
  • Ability to work, interact and consult with Hiring Managers from different levels of the organization and from different European countries
  • Attention to detail and ability to drive accountability
  • Organizational skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks and set priorities in a fast-paced environment
  • Negotiation skills
  • Ability to work independently

Benefits

We offer:

  • To join a stable global company
  • To gain experience and grow your expertise in a variety of areas and industries
  • To dive deep into the world of modern technology-related branches
  • To enjoy lots of flexibility related to: working hours, type of contract, diversity of projects and location as with 100% home office you can literally work from any place in the world as soon as there is internet connection ;)

results.title: Recruitment Partner
results.description:
Company Description

Recruitment Partner

Our Chief Operating Officer started at The Curve Group as a Resourcing Consultant, she now runs all of our operations. This isn’t unusual here – our Projects Director, Head of Recruitment Operations, Head of Client Services, Resourcing Leads and many others have had the same career trajectory.

Business is booming and our Recruitment Outsourcing team is growing, we’re looking for a Recruitment Partner for one of our outsourced recruitment clients.

This is still a hands on Recruitment role where you will also manage and partner with senior stakeholders within the business.



Job Description

Ideally you’ll be coming from an RPO environment and have a strong background as a hands on recruiter and have a solid understanding of the end-to-end recruitment outsource model. In addition to this, you’ll have a great track record in:

  • Delivering high volume and professional/technical recruitment through a best-in-class delivery team
  • Business partnering senior stakeholders up to ExCo/Director level and a proven understanding of what it takes to build strong relationships with key stakeholders whilst challenging and influencing their thinking and actions

What’s involved

  • Overall responsibility for the end-to-end recruitment process, working with delivery teams – planning and developing appropriate resourcing strategies in line with this
  • Hands on recruitment delivery
  • Advising on EVP (Employee Value Proposition) and promoting employer brand - measured by how this is effectively communicated to the external market
  • Advising on assessment techniques
  • Being the Initial point of escalation for any issues and then managing these through to resolution effectively
  • Manage the engagement, relationship and performance of 3rd party agency partners working with Supply Chain Management Team
  • Analysing, interpreting and presenting management information back to your client
  • Creating, inputting into and maintaining a strategic account management plan
  • Accurately forecasting revenue from your client, highlighting any risks
  • Leading/attending client review meetings as required



Qualifications



Additional Information

Let’s be honest, in the current market there are a ton of opportunities for a person like you – so why is this job any different?

  • We’re the UK’s largest privately owned HR & Recruitment provider. Our growth over the last 16 years has been extraordinary, we’re now nearing 100 staff
  • Flexible working from client site in London and home
  • 35 hour working week - fancy an afternoon off once per week?
  • 25 days holiday to start, with the option to buy 5 more. Your standard holiday entitlement increases a day per year (to 30 days) with the option to buy more
  • Beautiful offices in a converted barn in the Northamptonshire countryside – with cows, chickens and the occasional horse
  • Great socials including Curvefest - our very own festival and ‘thank you’ from management full of fun, food, frivolity and bands
  • We’ve been recognised as both innovative and disruptive and we have the awards to prove it! (‘Most Innovative Recruitment Company’, ‘Recruitment Process Outsourcer of the Year’, ‘Best Customer Focus’, ‘Best Employer’ and ‘Best Customer Service’)

results.title: Senior Manager, Talent & Recruitment Consulting
results.description:
Company Description

KIPP Public Schools is a national network of public charter schools that prepares students with the skills and confidence to create the future they want for themselves, their communities, and us all. We are a network of 270 schools, nearly 10,000 educators, and more than 160,000 students and alumni.   

  
Our mission: Together with families and communities, we create joyful, academically excellent schools that prepare students with the skills and confidence to pursue the paths they choose—college, career, and beyond—so they can lead fulfilling lives and build a more just world.  

  

Our vision: Every child grows up free to create the future they want for themselves and their communities.  

  

The KIPP Foundation is a nonprofit organization that supports KIPP schools across the country. The KIPP Foundation trains and develops outstanding educators to lead KIPP public schools; provides tools, resources and training for excellent teaching and learning; promotes innovation; and facilitates the exchange of insights and ideas across KIPP and other public schools and organizations.  



Job Description

About The Position 

As the Senior Manager, Talent & Recruitment Consulting, you will be a key member of KIPP Foundation’s Network Talent Team, contributing to our team purpose to build and sustain healthy talent ecosystems within KIPP regions. You will support our strategy to build KIPP regions’ capacity to recruit and hire excellent, anti-racist teachers and leaders, ensuring that schools are 80% hired by the last day of school. You will partner closely with over 25 regions to create and iterate on the resources that support 125+ recruiters across the country, including the codified KIPP Recruitment Playbook that outlines research-backed best practices. You will also be the product manager for the network-wide Applicant Tracking System, helping our KIPP regions develop data monitoring systems that lead to equitable hiring practices and a diverse teacher workforce. 

 

Responsibilities 

As the Senior Manager, Talent & Recruitment Consulting, you will be responsible for: 

 

Strategy Development    

  • In collaboration with the Director, Talent & Recruitment Consulting, codify and define best practices for recruitment and selection of teachers and leaders to ensure schools are 80% hired by the last day of school 

  • Conduct research, synthesize findings and make recommendations on effective and equitable recruitment practices 

  • Lead process to revise and project manage the KIPP Recruitment Playbook, managing workload across the team and ensuring playbook publication strategy meets regional needs 

  • Support in designing the strategy to develop KIPP’s regional recruiters and recruitment team managers  

  • Collaborate with all team members to continuously identify opportunities for improvement and increased efficiency in cross-team work 

   

Management and Execution   

  • Partner with regions to build their recruitment systems and practices so that they create robust and equitable recruitment pipelines  

  • Lead project management for revisions to the Playbook and other resources that support regional recruiter development  

  • Lead communications with recruitment community, including monthly newsletter, requests for data collection, updates on tools, etc.   

  • Product manage the KIPP recruitment tools, including our Applicant Tracking System, staffing plan, exemplars and templates for the Playbook; iterate on existing tools to align with research and best practices 

  • Support the planning of virtual learning sessions for regional recruiters to track data, get training on the use of recruitment tools, and share network-wide lessons learned  

  • Manage network-wide contracts with outside vendors and relevant communications with regions  

  • Design approach to measuring impact and adjust solutions based on data    

   

Team Leadership   

  • Contribute to cohesive execution of the team vision and collaboration across the team and the overall KIPP Foundation  

  • Connect with teammates to ensure coordination across the team, in service of our regions; look across the KIPP Foundation to ensure collaboration and cohesion of strategy; work effectively across lines of difference to drive our goals for equitable talent systems across the KIPP network 

 

Skills  

  • Tool & Product Development: Excellent product manager who can lead a product management process to create valuable, research-based, user-friendly, high-use tools 

  • Planning & Execution: Skilled at project management; able to own a project plan from kick-off to close-out, driving multiple competing priorities forward  

  • Critical Thinking & Problem Solving: Adept at problem solving and critical thinking; able to structure analyses, formulate hypotheses, gather and synthesize data, develop and assess alternatives and build a case for recommendations    

  • Stakeholder Management & Communication: Strong stakeholder manager who can build and engage in productive relationships with regional leaders to inform product development and refinement; can effectively communicate to stakeholders both verbally and in written form 

  • Mission & Student Focus: Deep commitment to both racial and educational equity; supports the building of an organization that reflects the community KIPP serves; holds self and others accountable for centering equity  

  • Cultural Competence & Commitment to Equity: A proactive cultural leader and team player who thrives on collaboration and learning; can effectively collaborate with teammates across lines of difference 



Qualifications

Experience and Qualifications 

  • 5+ years of relevant work experience operating in product development and/or management and/or knowledge management, ideally for a school system or in an education nonprofit  

  • Experience in the field of talent strategy highly preferred, including deep functional knowledge of recruitment processes and systems   

  • Track record of successful project management including the execution of on time work and ability to collaborate successfully with teammates and other partners  

  • Experience with an Applicant Tracking System a plus (SmartRecruiters, Salesforce, Workday, etc) 

 

Work Conditions 

  • The Senior Manager, Talent & Recruitment Consulting will report to the Director, Talent & Recruitment Consulting 

  • Travel requirements: Up to 10% 

  • Full-time, exempt role 



Additional Information

Work Conditions 

Willingness to travel frequently (10-12 days monthly and 4-6 consecutive weeks during the summer), including some weekends 

 

Location 

It is preferred, but not mandatory for this role to be based out of Washington DC given the focus on event planning in Policy and Public Affairs.  This role also has the option of working from a remote office full time.  KIPP Foundation office is in NYC, Chicago, San Francisco, and Washington DC.     

 

Compensation and Benefits
KIPP offers a competitive salary commensurate with experience. Our comprehensive benefits package include:

  • 20 vacation days + 18 days additional flexible PTO days (flexible PTO increases to 23 days for year 3 and 4 and to 28 days for years 5+).
  • 100% paid parental leave
  • 100% coverage of the premium for employee and 75% for employee + family’s medical/dental/vision plans.
  • Wellness benefits such as fitness reimbursements, discounted tickets to theme parks/attraction, back-up care support for children and adults/elders, and our employee assistance program
  • Finance Security benefits include such as a 401K retirement plan with 4% match, employer sponsored legal plans, and life/disability insurance, and flexible spending accounts
  •  

  

 

KIPP Foundation is an equal opportunity employer and an organization that values diversity. People from all diverse backgrounds are strongly encouraged to apply.

results.title: Talent Coordinator
results.description:
Company Description

At Viral Nation, we specialize in building social-first ecosystems for brands to connect with the modern consumer journey. Our integrated solutions align strategy, talent, media, and technology with culturally relevant creativity to scale the world’s fastest-growing digital brands. Viral Nation offers a fluid, creative, and growth-oriented environment that will support your ambitions to apply your talents in an open, collaborative, and fast-paced culture. Our ability to stay at the forefront of the industry has fueled our success and will guide us in paving the path forward. We’re driven to push boundaries and think beyond today to deliver strategies, and we’re just getting started.

2021 was a transformational year for Viral Nation, having grown by 200%, and we have even bigger ambitions for 2022 and beyond. While we continuously exceed our goals, we need your help – our success is only as great as our people. Strong performance leads to high expectations, and we must keep raising the bar!

Our Values:

We Constantly Evolve: Embracing change is both an opportunity and a necessity!

Courage: Challenging the norm drives us forward!

Diversity: We strive for excellence and recognize that our differences make us stronger. We respect and seek out the inclusion of differences, realizing we can learn from each other!

Resilience: Adversity is a springboard for growth

We are seeking a professional and organized Talent Coordinator to work within our influencer talent agency division to assist our team in representing and managing the careers of various social media influencers' careers.

Must be a positive, creative, and dedicated hard worker who can balance a multitude of tasks in an extremely fast work paced environment. The incumbent should possess a basic understanding of social media marketing, brand partnerships, talent management, talent representation, and contract negotiations and have an existing deep network of social media influencers.



Job Description
  • Assist in discovering and signing large influencers who are looking for business management.
  • Working with influencers on a daily basis to process requests, remind them of posting schedules, and discuss any new opportunities.
  • Represent the business and brands of leading social media personalities.
  • Assist the Talent Agents with brand partnerships for specific talent and the agency as a whole.
  • Stay on top of trends in the influencer marketing space.
  • Assist the Talent team in pursuing new opportunities: such as TV and Film casting for our talent, adopters for new apps, and finding collaboration opportunities for our exclusive influencers and other large influencers.
  • Present and assist with the execution of growth strategies for influencers.



Qualifications
  • Must have a basic understanding of talent management/talent representation of Social Media Influencers and/or celebrities.
  • The candidate must have a university degree or college diploma and/or equivalent experience.
  • Must have an existing deep network of social media influencers and talent.
  • Must have experience professionally managing brand partnerships and in talent management (preferably at an agency).



Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

 

Viral Nation is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion in our agency. Viral Nation welcomes applications from people with visible and non-visible disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruiting and selection process.

results.title: Director, People Development
results.description:
Marqeta powers innovative payment solutions for many of the apps and services you enjoy daily. Our open API provides unprecedented flexibility and control for industry-leading companies such as Uber, Coinbase, J.P.Morgan, and Block, to manage payment operations in real-time. 

Our team is a mix of industry experts and technology innovators who take a dynamic approach to solving challenging problems. Marqeta was named a 2022 Glassdoor Best Place to Work, highlighting our company culture and collaborative work environment. We are building a global team as diverse as the markets we serve and we’d love it if you joined us on our mission to change the way money moves. 

We’re a remote-first company. You have the choice to work from wherever you’re happiest and most productive, whether that’s from home, a co-working space, or one of our four global offices, depending on your location. It’s uncommon for candidates to match all job requirements, but if you’re not far off, we want to hear from you.

Position Summary

At Marqeta we are committed to growing and developing our people to ensure they are enabled to do the best work of their life. The Director of Talent Management will partner with the People Experience leadership team to develop and execute Marqeta’s talent management strategy. The Director is responsible for overseeing all talent management initiatives including performance management, succession planning and career journeys to drive our strategic business goals.  

What You'll Do
  • Lead the strategic approach, design, continuous improvement, and implementation of our talent, performance, and succession planning processes
  • Ensure that the programs and strategy are integrated, aligned, and complement other major People Experience initiatives, and support Marqeta’s overall strategic direction 
  • Evaluate industry trends and best practices in talent management, performance and succession planning and develop recommendations that will enable people and business leaders to drive our strategic objectives forward 
  • Leverage technology platforms and provide insights and recommendations for action
  • Use predictive analytics to inform and innovate talent management, performance and succession
What We're Looking For
  • 10+ years of relevant work experience with 5+ years leading talent management, performance and talent programs, and/or succession planning 
  • Ability to manage projects with multiple stakeholders that require both strategic and hands-on implementation 
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to influence various levels of stakeholders, including C-Suite 
  • Coaching and assessment accreditations

Benefits and Perks

  • Flexible time off – take what you need
  • Retirement savings program with company contribution
  • Employee insurance premiums paid 100% + coverage for dependents and pets
  • Family forming benefits including fertility support and up to 20 weeks Parental Leave
  • Free therapy sessions, financial coaching, and a Wellness stipend
  • Monthly stipend to support our hybrid work model 
  • Equity in a publicly-traded company
  • Bi-annual “Hack Week” to support and reward innovation

Learn more about Marqeta on our Website, Twitter and LinkedIn.

Our Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice applies to the personal data that you directly provide to us or that we collect during the application and candidate recruitment process.

results.title: Technical Recruiter
results.description:
** This job is open to all applicants authorized to work in North America and is remote!

Battlefy needs your help to make esports shine. We are looking for an experienced full-cycle recruiter to join our team. We are looking for talented individuals who can help us drive growth in the business of competitive gaming.

Our platform powers esports. Players and organizers love the Battlefy platform for its best-in-class functionality. We're on a mission to bring competitive video games to the world through organized competition, and we are incredibly excited about the future of esports.

When you join the Battlefy team you will join a talented, truly-passionate group of people looking to help everyone succeed. We will support your growth as an individual, provide you with new challenges, and compensate you fairly for your contributions. Your work will be valued at Battlefy. We're building something new -- a thriving ecosystem of players, organizers, and sponsors.

Here's what we need you to do:

Spend more than 50% of your time talking to candidates. We are a high volume organization with strong screening criteria.

Aggressively push new candidate intro screening, driving funnel activity to our internal Battlefy team members, delivering 15 new candidates per week for interview.

Conduct cultural assessments of candidates through top grading, culture-specific behavioral interviews, and initial intro screens.

Source new candidates for open jobs as required, helping to push up average experience level of the teams by bringing senior, experienced candidates in to the funnel.

Shepherd candidates throughout the hiring journey from source to close.

Routinely report on progress, challenges, and activity to internal stakeholders.

Requirements

Startup experience required. Agency experience a very strong plus.

Ability to drive significant recruitment volume by being a high agency, high volume performer.

Comfortable acting as the Champion of company culture, representing the values of the team. Can communicate the above effectively with candidates.

Strong negotiation skills and can close candidates whenever required.

Good research skills (compensation, candidate sourcing) and a tendency to research everything. The successful candidate will take nothing for granted.

Excellent communicator generally, but also takes time to overcommunicate with internal stakeholders, providing routine updates on performance and progress.

Digital native, can use any technology resource available to perform job functions. Well versed in ATS, Google suite (or equivalent), and other online tools.

Extreme attention to detail.

Openness to challenge and feedback, can be agile to meet changing circumstances.

Benefits

We offer:

  • A competitive salary
  • Stock options
  • Flex time off
  • Company sponsored team-building events
  • Be a part of a group of like minded individuals who will push each other to better themselves everyday
